TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/Window/SmallMinCaption extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of the title bar of a minimized small window. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.Window.SmallMinCaption class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the title bar of a minimized small window, such as a tool window.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.Window.SmallMinCaption.Active%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowSmallMinCaption1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#342](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_126_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#342](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_126_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the title bar of an active small window that is minimized.
Docs.value: A that represents the title bar of an active small window that is minimized.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Active property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Active property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowSmallMinCaption1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#342](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/5017156e-7726-4121-b581-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#342](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/5017156e-7726-4121-b581-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the title bar of a disabled small window that is minimized.
Docs.value: A that represents the title bar of a disabled small window that is minimized.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowSmallMinCaption3` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#344](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/8f442a35-b9ad-474f-a5cf-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#344](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/8f442a35-b9ad-474f-a5cf-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents the title bar of an inactive small window that is minimized.
Docs.value: A that represents the title bar of an inactive small window that is minimized.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Inactive property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Inactive property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementWindowSmallMinCaption2` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
